title: Advanced Features
description: Explore advanced features including webhooks, batch operations, and custom integrations.

children.value: Discover powerful advanced features that can enhance your workflow and automate complex tasks.
Webhooks allow you to receive real-time notifications when events occur in your account.
Configure webhooks through the API or dashboard to receive HTTP POST requests when events occur.
Verify webhook signatures to ensure requests are from our servers:
Process multiple items efficiently with batch operations.
Create multiple documents in a single request:
Add custom metadata to your documents with custom fields.
Leverage advanced search capabilities with filters, sorting, and aggregations.
Track changes and maintain version history for your documents.
Enable real-time collaborative editing with WebSocket connections.
Handle concurrent edits with operational transform:
Create reusable templates for consistent document structure.
Optimize performance with advanced rate limiting and caching strategies.
Monitor your API usage with response headers:
Track API usage and document performance with built-in analytics.
Track custom events for detailed analytics:
These advanced features provide powerful capabilities for complex use cases. For additional support:
Contact our support team for enterprise features
Ready to implement these features? Start with the
guide if you haven't already set up your project.

title: API Reference
description: Complete API reference with examples and detailed documentation for all endpoints.

children.value: Complete reference for all available API endpoints, including request/response examples and authentication details.
All API requests require authentication using an API key. Include your API key in the request headers:

props.code:
curl -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY" \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
     https://api.example.com/v1/endpoint

children.value: All API endpoints are relative to the base URL:

props.code: https://api.example.com/v1

children.value: Retrieve the current user's profile information.
Update the current user's profile information.
Retrieve a list of all documents with optional filtering and pagination.
Retrieve a specific document by ID.

title: Getting Started
description: Learn how to get started with our platform in just a few simple steps.

children.value: Welcome to our platform! This guide will help you get up and running quickly.
Before you begin, make sure you have the following:
A code editor of your choice
Follow these steps to install and set up the platform:

props.code:
git clone https://github.com/your-org/your-project.git
cd your-project

npm install
# or
yarn install

API_URL=https://api.example.com
API_KEY=your-api-key-here
DATABASE_URL=your-database-url

npm run dev
# or
yarn dev

children.value: Your application should now be running at
Here's an overview of the project structure:

props.code:
project/
 src/
    components/     # Reusable components
    pages/          # Page components
    utils/          # Utility functions
    styles/         # CSS and styling
 public/             # Static assets
 docs/              # Documentation
 package.json       # Project configuration

children.value:
project/
 src/
    components/     # Reusable components
    pages/          # Page components
    utils/          # Utility functions
    styles/         # CSS and styling
 public/             # Static assets
 docs/              # Documentation
 package.json       # Project configuration
Now that you have the platform running locally, you might want to:
If you run into any issues, check out our
or reach out to our support team.

title: Quick Start
description: Get up and running in 5 minutes with this quick start guide.

children.value: Get your project running in just 5 minutes with this streamlined setup process.

props.code:
npx create-nuxt-app@latest my-docs-site
cd my-docs-site
npm install @nuxt/content @nuxtjs/tailwindcss

children.value: Step 4: Create Your First Page (1 minute)

props.code: npm run dev

children.value: Your documentation site is now running at
Here are the commands you'll use most frequently:
Add frontmatter with title and description
Your content will automatically be available at the corresponding route
Use Tailwind classes directly in your components
: Enable TypeScript for better development experience
: Organize content in folders for better structure
: Add meta tags and structured data
: Enable static generation for better performance

children.text: Step 4: Create Your First Page (1 minute)

title: Troubleshooting
description: Common issues and solutions to help you resolve problems quickly.

children.value: Find solutions to common issues and problems you might encounter.
Getting errors during installation or build process.
Ensure you're using Node.js 18 or higher:

props.code:
node --version
# Should show v18.0.0 or higher

# If you need to update Node.js
# Using nvm (recommended)
nvm install 18
nvm use 18

# Or download from nodejs.org

children.value: # If you need to update Node.js

props.code:
# Clear npm cache
npm cache clean --force

# Try installing again
npm install

# If still failing, try with different registry
npm install --registry https://registry.npmjs.org/

children.value: # If still failing, try with different registry
Development server can't start because port 3000 is in use.

props.code:
# Find what's using port 3000
lsof -ti:3000

# Kill the process (replace PID with actual process ID)
kill -9 PID

# Or start on a different port
npm run dev -- --port 3001

children.value: # Kill the process (replace PID with actual process ID)
# Or start on a different port
Changes to files don't trigger automatic reloads.
Check if you're editing files outside the project directory

props.code:
# Stop with Ctrl+C, then restart
npm run dev

# Make sure Tailwind is properly configured
npm install @nuxtjs/tailwindcss

# Check nuxt.config.ts includes:
# modules: ['@nuxtjs/tailwindcss']

# Restart dev server after config changes

children.value: # Make sure Tailwind is properly configured
# Restart dev server after config changes
Markdown content isn't showing up on pages.

props.code:
---
title: Your Title
description: Your description
---

children.value: Restart development server after adding new content files

props.code:
# Clear .nuxt directory
rm -rf .nuxt

# Clear node_modules and reinstall
rm -rf node_modules package-lock.json
npm install

# Try building again
npm run build

children.value: Check that all content queries use proper async data composables:
Build process runs out of memory.

props.code:
# Increase Node.js memory limit
NODE_OPTIONS="--max-old-space-size=4096" npm run build

# Or add to package.json scripts:
"build": "NODE_OPTIONS='--max-old-space-size=4096' nuxt build"

children.value: Pages take too long to load.

props.code: npm run generate

<!-- Use Nuxt Image component -->
<NuxtImg src="/image.jpg" width="400" height="300" />
npm run build --analyze

# Clear node_modules and reinstall
rm -rf node_modules package-lock.json
npm install

# Check import paths are correct
# Use ~ for project root: ~/components/MyComponent.vue

children.value: Avoid using browser-only APIs in server-side code
For static generation, ensure routes are prerendered
Add debugging to your development environment:

props.code:
# Add to .env
DEBUG=nuxt:*
NUXT_DEBUG=true

# Run with debug output
npm run dev

children.value: # Check browser console for client-side errors
If you can't find a solution here:
Contact support with detailed error information

props.code:
npm audit
npm update
npm install --save-dev typescript

npm run build
npm run preview

children.value: for warnings and errors during development

props.code:
<script setup>
defineErrorHandling((error) => {
  console.error('Component error:', error)
})
</script>

children.value: Remember: Most issues have been encountered by others. Search existing resources before creating new support requests!
